Software Description: [Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0030) is a full-featured, remote backdoor used by a group of the same name ([Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0008)). It is intended for espionage, data exfiltration, and providing remote access to infected machines. (Citation: Kaspersky Carbanak) (Citation: FireEye CARBANAK June 2017)
Mitigation Description: Use signatures or heuristics to detect malicious software.
Application: Consider utilizing the Antimalware Scan Interface (AMSI) on Windows 10 to analyze commands after being processed/interpreted.
Use: [Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0030) encrypts strings to make analysis more difficult.

Mitigation Description: Perform audits or scans of systems, permissions, insecure software, insecure configurations, etc. to identify potential weaknesses.
Application: Audit the Remote Desktop Users group membership regularly. Remove unnecessary accounts and groups from Remote Desktop Users groups
Use: [Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0030) enables concurrent Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP).

Software Description: [Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0030) is a full-featured, remote backdoor used by a group of the same name ([Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0008)). It is intended for espionage, data exfiltration, and providing remote access to infected machines. (Citation: Kaspersky Carbanak) (Citation: FireEye CARBANAK June 2017)
Mitigation Description: Use capabilities to prevent suspicious behavior patterns from occurring on endpoint systems. This could include suspicious process, file, API call, etc. behavior.
Application: Some endpoint security solutions can be configured to block some types of process injection based on common sequences of behavior that occur during the injection process.
Use: [Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0030) downloads an executable and injects it directly into a new process.

Application: Disable the RDP service if it is unnecessary.
Use: [Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0030) enables concurrent Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP).

Software Description: [Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0030) is a full-featured, remote backdoor used by a group of the same name ([Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0008)). It is intended for espionage, data exfiltration, and providing remote access to infected machines. (Citation: Kaspersky Carbanak) (Citation: FireEye CARBANAK June 2017)
Mitigation Description: Block execution of code on a system through application whitelisting, blacklisting, and/or script blocking.
Application: Use application whitelisting to mitigate installation and use of unapproved software that can be used for remote access.
Use: [Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0030) has a plugin for VNC and Ammyy Admin Tool.

Mitigation Name: Limit Access to Resource Over Network
Software Description: [Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0030) is a full-featured, remote backdoor used by a group of the same name ([Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0008)). It is intended for espionage, data exfiltration, and providing remote access to infected machines. (Citation: Kaspersky Carbanak) (Citation: FireEye CARBANAK June 2017)
Mitigation Description: Prevent access to file shares, remote access to systems, unnecessary services. Mechanisms to limit access may include use of network concentrators, RDP gateways, etc.
Application: Use remote desktop gateways.
Use: [Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0030) enables concurrent Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP).

Software Description: [Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0030) is a full-featured, remote backdoor used by a group of the same name ([Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0008)). It is intended for espionage, data exfiltration, and providing remote access to infected machines. (Citation: Kaspersky Carbanak) (Citation: FireEye CARBANAK June 2017)
Mitigation Description: Use two or more pieces of evidence to authenticate to a system; such as username and password in addition to a token from a physical smart card or token generator.
Application: Use multi-factor authentication for remote logins.
Use: [Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0030) enables concurrent Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP).

Software Description: [Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0030) is a full-featured, remote backdoor used by a group of the same name ([Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0008)). It is intended for espionage, data exfiltration, and providing remote access to infected machines. (Citation: Kaspersky Carbanak) (Citation: FireEye CARBANAK June 2017)
Mitigation Description: Use two or more pieces of evidence to authenticate to a system; such as username and password in addition to a token from a physical smart card or token generator.
Application: Use multi-factor authentication for user and privileged accounts.
Use: [Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0030) can create a Windows account.

Software Description: [Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0030) is a full-featured, remote backdoor used by a group of the same name ([Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0008)). It is intended for espionage, data exfiltration, and providing remote access to infected machines. (Citation: Kaspersky Carbanak) (Citation: FireEye CARBANAK June 2017)
Mitigation Description: Use intrusion detection signatures to block traffic at network boundaries.
Application: Network intrusion detection and prevention systems that use network signatures to identify traffic for specific adversary malware can be used to mitigate activity at the network level. Since the custom protocol used may not adhere to typical protocol standards, there may be opportunities to signature the traffic on a network level for detection. Signatures are often for unique indicators within protocols and may be based on the specific protocol used by a particular adversary or tool, and will likely be different across various malware families and versions. Adversaries will likely change tool C2 signatures over time or construct protocols in such a way as to avoid detection by common defensive tools.
Use: [Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0030) uses XOR with random keys for its communications.

Software Description: [Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0030) is a full-featured, remote backdoor used by a group of the same name ([Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0008)). It is intended for espionage, data exfiltration, and providing remote access to infected machines. (Citation: Kaspersky Carbanak) (Citation: FireEye CARBANAK June 2017)
Mitigation Description: Use intrusion detection signatures to block traffic at network boundaries.
Application: Network intrusion detection and prevention systems that use network signatures to identify traffic for specific adversary malware can be used to mitigate activity at the network level.
Use: The [Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0030) malware communicates to its command server using HTTP with an encrypted payload.

Software Description: [Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0030) is a full-featured, remote backdoor used by a group of the same name ([Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0008)). Use: [Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0030) encrypts the message body of HTTP traffic with RC2 (in CBC mode) and Base64 encoding.

Mitigation Description: Architect sections of the network to isolate critical systems, functions, or resources. Use physical and logical segmentation to prevent access to potentially sensitive systems and information. Use a DMZ to contain any internet-facing services that should not be exposed from the internal network.
Application: Configure internal and external firewalls to block traffic using common ports that associate to network protocols that may be unnecessary for that particular network segment.
Use: [Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0030) uses Port Numbers 443 and 80 for the C2 server.

Software Description: [Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0030) is a full-featured, remote backdoor used by a group of the same name ([Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0008)). Mitigation Description: Architect sections of the network to isolate critical systems, functions, or resources. Use physical and logical segmentation to prevent access to potentially sensitive systems and information. Use a DMZ to contain any internet-facing services that should not be exposed from the internal network.
Application: Properly configure firewalls and proxies to limit outgoing traffic to only necessary ports and through proper network gateway systems. Also ensure hosts are only provisioned to communicate over authorized interfaces.
Use: [Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0030) uses a custom binary protocol for C2 communications.
